text: Targovishte Province (, transliterated Oblast Tǎrgovište, former name Targovishte okrug) is a province in northeastern Bulgaria, named after its main city - Targovishte. As of December 2009, it has a population of 129,675 inhabitants. There are two railway stations on the major railway line Sofia- Gorna Oryahovitsa - Varna. Targovishte Airport is located from the city of Targovishte. However, it is not being used because of a lack of financial resources. == Towns and villages == The place names in bold have the status of town (in Bulgarian: град, transliterated as grad).
